page.title: 01Local History- 1.GUILDTOWN
page.content: The village of Guildtown is situated 6 miles north of Perth on the A93. It is in the most northerly and second from the left section of our Domesday map reference. It is the only part of our area which can be said to be in any way a centre of population. About 260 people live in Guildtown - but about 60% of the pupils of our school do not live there at all. They live to the north of our designated Project area in and around the village of Wolfhill and in isolated farms and cottages. Guildtown has a Sub-post Office, one telephone box, one post box, a garage, and an Inn as well as the Village Hall, houses and the School. All around are woods and fields of raspberries, barley, wheat, peas and oil-seed rape.
